Package FinanceTrackerSystem.Controllers

Class AccountController

java.lang.Object
FinanceTrackerSystem.Controllers.AccountController
public class AccountController extends Object
Provides static methods to manage user accounts in the Finance Tracker System. This controller interacts with the currently logged-in user (currentUser) and performs operations such as adding, viewing, editing, deleting accounts, transferring funds, and retrieving account IDs.

Responsibilities

  • Create new accounts for users with specified names and initial balances.
  • Display all accounts belonging to the current user.
  • Edit account details, including name and balance.
  • Delete accounts by name.
  • Transfer funds between accounts, ensuring sufficient balance and atomic updates.
  • Retrieve account UUIDs by account name for cross-referencing in transactions and budgets.

Usage Example

 AccountController.addAccount("Savings", 1000.0);
 AccountController.viewAccounts();
 AccountController.editAccount("Savings", "Emergency Fund", 1200.0);
 AccountController.transferFunds("Savings", "Checking", 200.0);
 UUID id = AccountController.getAccountIdByName("Checking");

Dependencies

  • Account - The account model being managed.
  • User - The user model, accessed via currentUser.
  • UserController - For accessing currentUser and saving user details.

Thread Safety

This class is not thread-safe. All operations assume single-threaded access to currentUser. If used in a multi-threaded environment, external synchronization is required.

Validation

This class performs basic validation (e.g., account existence, sufficient funds for transfers). Further validation (such as name uniqueness or input format) should be handled externally.

Extensibility

Additional account operations (such as account type, currency, or audit logging) can be added as needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • AccountController

      public AccountController()

  • Method Details

    • addAccount

      public static boolean addAccount(String accountName, double initialBalance)
      Creates a new account for the current user with the specified name and initial balance. The account is added to the user's account list and persisted.
      Parameters:
      accountName - Name of the new account.
      initialBalance - Initial balance for the account.
      Returns:
      true if the account is added and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • viewAccounts

      public static void viewAccounts()
      Displays all accounts belonging to the current user. Prints "No accounts found." if there are no accounts. Each account is displayed using its Account.toString() representation.

    • deleteAccount

      public static boolean deleteAccount(String accountName)
      Deletes an account with the specified name from the current user's account list. If the account is found and deleted, user details are persisted.
      Parameters:
      accountName - Name of the account to delete.
      Returns:
      true if the account is deleted and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • editAccount

      public static boolean editAccount(String accountName, String newAccountName, double newBalance)
      Edits the name and balance of an existing account. If the account is found, updates its name and balance, then persists user details.
      Parameters:
      accountName - Name of the account to edit.
      newAccountName - New name for the account.
      newBalance - New balance for the account.
      Returns:
      true if the account is updated and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • transferFunds

      public static boolean transferFunds(String sourceAccountName, String destinationAccountName, double amount)
      Transfers funds from one account to another within the current user's accounts. Ensures both accounts exist and the source account has sufficient funds. Updates balances atomically and persists user details.
      Parameters:
      sourceAccountName - Name of the account to transfer funds from.
      destinationAccountName - Name of the account to transfer funds to.
      amount - Amount to transfer.
      Returns:
      true if the transfer is successful and user details are saved; false otherwise.

    • getAccountIdByName

      public static UUID getAccountIdByName(String accountName)
      Retrieves the unique ID (UUID) of an account by its name. Useful for cross-referencing accounts in transactions and budgets.
      Parameters:
      accountName - Name of the account.
      Returns:
      UUID of the account if found; null otherwise.
